content.description:
A brutal little boulder problem on the far right of the back-side of the Plumbers Crack Boulder.  

  Sit start with an incut left hand side-pull and a low, flat, right hand crimp. Hard first move to a gnarly potato chip edge out right, then work your way through small edges to the lip.  

  Very good rock quality. Would be 4 stars without a giant hole under you and if it wasn't squeezed in next to the Mole.
content.protection: 3-4 Pads. You'll need to fill in a body sized hole that's just beneath the climb with pads.
content.location: Just to the right of 'The Mole' V5/6 on the Plumbers Crack Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on a shallow crimps. Make big moves into the start of Split Decision
content.location: 10 feet right of Plumbers Crack. Sits next to Slice and Dice on low obvious holds

content.description: Climb the crimps left of unvarnished dihedral.
content.protection: Pad is recommended as landing is on jumbled rocks.
content.location: 5 to 10 feet right of Plumber's Crack.

content.description:
A brilliant boulder problem on the back side of the Plumbers Crack Boulder. Stays in the shade all day, and climbs some of the highest quality stone at Kraft.  

  Start with opposing side-pulls and a wide stem, make a hard move to a left hand pinch and then the crux move to a right facing ear. Finish up and right to an obvious jug at the top of the neighboring V5, top out via easy, albeit very highball terrain.  

  Although Slice N Dice is better known, it is a variation of 'Plunger' V9 which shares the same crux but takes it's own line straight to the top.
content.location: Back side (uphill side) of giant Plumbers Crack Boulder.

content.protection: There is a single bolt hanger at the top of the crack.
content.location: North side (farthest from parking area) of this boulder.

content.description:
The south (downhill) crack of this massive split boulder. Burl through the bottom then keep your cool for the run to the top. 

  There are bolts on top of this boulder which are accessible from either the downclimb on the north side or the north (uphill) side of the boulder.
Sit start with two crimps and options for feet, move up and right on crimps into the seam/crack on the right side of the boulder for the topout.
content.location: On the right side of the uphill side of the Plumber's Crack boulder, left of the downclimb. Sit start down and ~4 feet left of the vertical crack/seam in the boulder.

content.description: Leavittate the left leaning wide flake/crack on the boulder behind Plumber's Crack.  It can be laybacked at about 5.6, but that defeats the purpose of the exercise.
content.protection: Crashpad helpful if the heel-toe jams get too painful and you have to bail onto your head.
content.location: On the boulder to the north of Plumber's Crack.  LWC faces north.

content.description: Tall (25ft?) boulder, cleanly split; forming on the North side a V1/Veasy(R) chimney, and on the South side a V2(R) offwith. Really cool formation. There are several other problems on this boulder. This area is also sometimes referred to as "The Divided".
